Scott,


The axial velocity at the boundary is set indirectly when the mass
flux, temperature and composition
of the "Inlet"(s) boundary is set.  For example in the "flame1.py"
demo:
# set the properties at the burner
f.burner.set(massflux = mdot, mole_fractions = comp, temperature =
tburner)

Internally, the velocity is calculated by minimizing error between from
the mass flux the product
of the density and the velocity.   The density is calcualted by the
ideal gas law using the specified boundary 
temperature, the specified flame operatating pressure and the
calculated species mass fractions.  The species
mass fractions are determined, such that the mass flux of the
particular species is maintained as
opposed to fixing the value of the mass fraction of any particular
species.

I think the only boundary which this will work with is an "Inlet".

Hope this helps

Dave Huckaby

>>> thawdog@... 7/5/2005 5:25 PM >>>
Where do you set the axial velocity at a boundary and what classes of 
boundaries can it be set for?

Scott
